PATHOPHYSIOLOGY
INNERVATION
the upper facial muscles are inner
vated by both cerebral hemispheres, while the lower
facial muscles are only innervated by the contralateral
cerebral hemisphere. Thus, an upper motor neuron
lesion would spare the upper face, while a lower
motor neuron lesion would lead to ipsilateral upper
and lower facial weakness
